breakfast.description: A savory pancake made from yellow lentils, rich in protein and low in calories.
A healthy twist on the classic upma, made with fiber-rich oats and vegetables.
Steamed rice cakes that are low in fat, served with a vegetable and lentil stew.

lunch.description: A high-protein, high-fiber alternative to rice pulao, served with yogurt.
Whole wheat flatbread with a curry of seasonal vegetables, providing complex carbs and fiber.
A refreshing salad with greens, vegetables, and protein-rich grilled cottage cheese.

dinner.description: A light and easy-to-digest one-pot meal of rice, lentils, and mixed vegetables.
Lean protein from grilled fish served with fiber-rich stir-fried vegetables.
A simple, comforting, and nutritious soup made from lentils.

breakfast.food_name: Egg Bhurji with Whole Wheat Bread
breakfast.description: Scrambled eggs spiced with Indian herbs, a great source of high-quality protein.
Whole wheat flatbread stuffed with spiced cottage cheese, high in protein and carbs for energy.
A traditional protein shake made from roasted gram flour, milk, and a natural sweetener.

lunch.description: A classic combination of lean protein from chicken and complex carbohydrates from brown rice.
Kidney bean curry served with steamed rice, offering a complete amino acid profile.
A high-protein vegetarian option made from soya chunks in a flavorful gravy.

dinner.description: Marinated chicken or cottage cheese grilled to perfection, providing a lean protein boost.

dinner.food_name: Fish Curry with a side of vegetables
dinner.description: A light fish curry packed with omega-3 fatty acids and protein.
A rich curry made with black lentils and kidney beans, providing sustained energy and protein.

breakfast.description: A crepe made from finger millet (ragi) flour, which has a low glycemic index.
A spiced flatbread made with whole wheat flour and fenugreek leaves, known to help manage blood sugar.
A savory pancake made from gram flour (besan), which is high in fiber and protein.

lunch.food_name: Jowar Roti with Leafy Green Sabzi
lunch.description: Sorghum flatbread served with a side of stir-fried spinach or other leafy greens.
Bitter gourd curry, traditionally believed to have blood sugar-lowering properties.
A controlled portion of fiber-rich brown rice with a hearty vegetable and lentil stew.

dinner.food_name: Palak Paneer with one Multigrain Roti
dinner.description: Cottage cheese cubes in a spinach gravy, offering protein and essential nutrients with minimal carbs.
A very light curry with a low glycemic index, easy to digest and hydrating.
A warm and filling soup that provides fiber and protein without spiking blood sugar levels.
